page.title: 01INTRODUCTION NEW MALDEN
page.content: NEW MALDEN IS A RESIDENTIAL AREA SOUTH-WEST OF LONDON.IT WAS FIRST M NTIONED IN THE DOMESDAY BOOK AS TWO MANORS;FROM THEN IT EXPANDED GRADUALLY. HENRY THE EIGHTH BUILT HIS SPLENDID COUNTRY PALACE AT NONSUCH IN 120 ACRES FROM THE LANDS OF MALDEN MANOR.THESE LANDS ARE NOW WORCESTER PARK.MUCH OF THIS AREA DEVELOPED AS A RESIDENTIAL SUBURB IN THE 1930'S WHEN MANY HOUSES WERE BUILT TO ACCOMODATE LONDON'S OVERSPILL. NEW MALDEN IS A PLEASANT,QUIET AREA WHERE THE ROADS ARE LEAFY AND HAVE ATTRACTIVE,SMALL GARDENS.IT IS A PEACEFUL AREA WHERE CHILDREN CAN GROW UP.THERE ARE SEVERAL PARKS AND PLAYING FIELDS WHICH CAN BE USED FOR RECREATIONAL PURPOSES.THE AREA IS WELL SERVED BY LOCAL TRANSPORT TO NEIGHBOURING TOWNS.THERE IS A FAST RAILWAY SERVICE TO LONDON.
